creditline: Lent by Richard and Diana Rose
description: mint green; main body of phone attaches to wall; back-side of main body rectangular shaped, but curves out on front of body; metal hang-up lever cradles to hold hand-set which hangs; circular dial attached on circular unit on top of main body; separate, square wall plug unit; hand-set and body attached with green spiral cord
dimension: 11 x 3 x 6 3/4 in. (27.94 x 7.62 x 17.15 cm) (main body and hand-set)
text: As the name implies, this telephone was meant to save room in the new, modern, space-efficient kitchen.  The year this phone was first manufactured (1955), Automatic Electric Company changed its name to General Telephone Electronics (GTE), only three years before the modem was invented.
title: "Space-Saver" rotary-dial wall phone
